workflow.name: Automated Google Business reports with GPT insights to Slack & email
workflow.description:
**Created by:** Peyton Leveillee  
**Last updated:** October 2025  

---

### ðŸ§  TL;DR  
Marketing companies charge **hundreds or even thousands per month** for automated â€œGoogle Business Pulseâ€ reports that show visibility, reviews, and engagement trends.  
Now you can do it **for free** â€” right inside **n8n**.  
This workflow pulls Google Business data, compares weekly and 12-week trends, runs it through an **LLM for insight summaries**, and sends out **Slack updates** and **weekly email reports** â€” automatically.

---

### ðŸ”¥ Name: **Google Pulse Pro**
Your **AI marketing analyst** that runs 24/7 â€” no subscription, no fluff.

---

### ðŸ§© Categories
- Business Intelligence  
- Marketing Automation  
- AI Summarization  
- Multichannel Reporting  

---

### ðŸ’¬ Overview
**Google Pulse Pro** automates weekly Google Business reporting for multiple companies or locations.  
It combines **data collection**, **trend analysis**, and **AI commentary** into a fully automated system â€” delivering updates through **Slack** and **email**.  
Perfect for agencies or businesses that want client-ready, insight-driven updates without paying for SaaS dashboards.

---

### âš™ï¸ Good to Know
- Uses **OpenAI Chat Models** for summarization and insights  
- Integrates **Google Business API**, **Google Sheets**, **Slack**, and **Email (Gmail or SMTP)**  
- Compares **this week vs last week** and **12-week averages**  
- Outputs **LLM-generated summaries** formatted for Slack Blocks and email templates  
- 100% no-code friendly â€” ready to deploy instantly  

---

### ðŸ§  How It Works

1. **Read Companies (Google Sheets)**  
   Loads company info, Google Business IDs, Slack channels, and recipient emails.

2. **Pull Google Business Data**  
   Queries the Google Business API for **impressions, actions, CTR, and reviews** across:
   - This week  
   - Last week  
   - 12-week average  

3. **Summarize & Compare**  
   Code nodes calculate trends and append results back to Google Sheets.

4. **AI Summaries (OpenAI)**  
   Three separate LLMs generate insight lines:  
   - **Impressions one-liner** â†’ Visibility & engagement shifts  
   - **Reviews one-liner** â†’ Sentiment & reputation trends  
   - **Overall one-liner** â†’ Combined marketing summary  

5. **Format & Distribute**  
   All one-liners merge per company. Recipients are attached, and messages are formatted for output.  

6. **Send Reports**  
   - **Slack:** Beautifully formatted updates via Slack Blocks  
   - **Email:** Branded **Weekly Google Business Pulse** summaries  

---

### ðŸ“ˆ Example Output

**Slack Message:**

Weekly Google Reviews & Impressions
Number 1 Auto Repair
Sept 22â€“28, 2025

â€¢ Impressions down 41% vs last week
â€¢ CTR 3pp lower than 12-week avg
â€¢ 2 new reviews, 100% positive sentiment

**Email Pulse:**

![Screenshot 20251005 at 7.06.20â€¯PM.png](fileId:2766)




---

### ðŸ§¾ Requirements
- **Google Business API credential** (OAuth2)  
- **Google Sheets credential** (OAuth2)  
- **Slack credential** (OAuth2) â€” `chat:write`, `users:read`, `channels:read`  
- **Gmail or SMTP credential** (for email pulse delivery)  
- **OpenAI credential** (for summaries)

---

### âœï¸ Customizing
- Add other KPIs (Google Ads, GA4, POS data)  
- Adjust scheduling cadence (daily, bi-weekly, monthly)  
- Send reports to Notion, Airtable, or HubSpot  
- Update Slack + email branding for your agency  

---

### ðŸ’¡ Use Cases
- Agencies automating client reporting  
- Multi-location businesses monitoring reputation  
- Service centers tracking performance trends  
- Anyone tired of paying for â€œGoogle Business Pulseâ€ dashboards  

---

### ðŸŽ¯ Why It Matters
Most marketing firms hide behind â€œAI dashboardsâ€ to sell visibility reports.  
**Google Pulse Pro** gives you that same power â€” **automated, AI-enhanced, and free**.

Unchain your reporting. Impress clients.  
And keep your marketing dollars where they belong â€” **in your business.**

nodes.name: map and summarize last 12 weeks reviews
Map + categorize reviews (last week, single node)

options.systemMessage:
You are a marketing analyst. Return STRICT JSON per schema.
One sentence, plain English: compare review volume vs last week and 12-week average, note sentiment (positive share) and reply behavior (rate + speed).
Avoid numeric dumps; use words like up/down/flat; hours as â€œslow/fastâ€ unless a simple figure helps (â€œ~3hâ€). No extra fields.

You are a marketing analyst. Return STRICT JSON per schema.
One sentence, plain English: compare impressions, actions, and CTR vs last week and vs the 12-week average.
Prefer words (up/down/flat); avoid numeric dumps; only use â€œppâ€ for CTR if needed. No extra fields.

You are a marketing analyst. Return STRICT JSON per schema.
Write ONE concise sentence for executives, plain English, minimal numbers.
Say whether traffic and actions are up/down/flat vs last week AND vs the 12-week average; mention CTR status; mention review volume + sentiment.
Avoid numeric values except short cues like â€œ12-week averageâ€ or â€œ+2 ppâ€ if essential. No emojis. No extra fields.

parameters.content:
# ðŸ§© Setup Guide: Google Business â†’ Slack + Weekly Pulse Email Workflow

This workflow automates your **Google Business performance reporting** by:

- Pulling data from Google Business Profiles (impressions, actions, CTR, reviews)
- Comparing results vs **last week** and the **12-week average**
- Generating **LLM-powered summaries**
- Sending formatted **Slack updates** and a **weekly pulse email**

---

## âœ… Prerequisites

Before activating the workflow, make sure you have the following ready:

### 1. Google Sheet for Companies  
ðŸ‘‰ [**Copy this Template**](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1u-87I9CUywZwiy9oDTUkMrVSADzeojk2UTTJRs3YOGY/edit?usp=sharing)

**Steps:**
- Go to **File â†’ Make a copy**
- Add one row per company
- Include the following columns:
  - `Company Name`
  - `Google Business ID`
  - `Slack Channel` (e.g. `#brads-service-center`)
  - `Slack Recipients` (comma-separated Slack IDs)
  - `Email Recipients` (for the weekly pulse)

---

### 2. Google Business API Credential
- Create a **Google Cloud Project** with the **Business Profile API** enabled  
- Connect in n8n via a **Google Business OAuth2** credential

---

### 3. Google Sheets Credential
- Add a **Google Sheets OAuth2** credential in n8n  
- Used to read the company data from your Google Sheet

---

### 4. Slack Credential
- Add a **Slack OAuth2** credential in n8n  
- Required permissions:
  - `chat:write`
  - `users:read`
  - `channels:read`

---

### 5. Email Credential
(Optional but recommended)  
- Add a **Gmail** or **SMTP** credential in n8n for sending the weekly pulse email

### ðŸ§­ Impressions Data Collection

This section gathers **visibility metrics** from Google Business Profiles:

- Collects data for **this week**, **last week**, and the **12-week average**
- Tracks **impressions, actions, and CTR** â€” showing how often your business is seen and how effectively customers engage
- Results are **flattened and written** back to the Google Sheet for use in weekly summaries, Slack messages, and pulse emails

### Gather company data from google sheets 

This section gathers your company info from google sheets to later fill out the HTTP requests to the google business api

### ðŸ’¬ Reviews Data Collection & Summaries

This section gathers **review data** from Google Business Profiles across multiple timeframes:

- **Current week:** Captures new reviews, sentiment (positive/neutral/negative), and reply rate  
- **Last week:** Provides a direct week-over-week comparison  
- **12-week average:** Establishes a performance baseline to show longer-term trends  
- **All-time summary:** Aggregates total reviews, overall rating, and reply metrics for historical context  

Each batch is **mapped, categorized, and summarized** using n8n code nodes, then written to the Google Sheet.  
The data feeds into the **LLM summary and weekly pulse email**, helping identify shifts in reputation and engagement over time.

### ðŸ§  LLM Summaries & One-Liners

This section combines and formats all key metrics before generating **AI-powered summaries**.

- **Merge2 + Join All:** Collects results from the impressions, actions, CTR, and reviews pipelines  
- **Format Node:** Structures the combined data into a clean JSON payload for the LLMs  

Then, three **OpenAI Chat Model** nodes create short, natural-language insights:
- **Overall one-liner:** A concise summary tying together visibility, engagement, and reputation  
- **Reviews one-liner:** Focused on review volume, sentiment, and response quality  
- **Impressions one-liner:** Highlights visibility and click-through performance week-over-week  

These summaries feed directly into the **Slack messages** and **weekly pulse email**, making complex performance data easy to read and actionable.

### ðŸ“¬ Distribution: Slack & Weekly Pulse Emails

This section prepares and sends the **final summaries** to each company via Slack and email.

- **Merge One Liners:** Combines all AI-generated one-liners (overall, impressions, and reviews)  
- **Normalize Keys:** Cleans and aligns data field names across merged results  
- **Read + Normalize Recipients:** Pulls recipient details (Slack channels and email addresses) from the Google Sheet  
- **Attach Recipients:** Joins each companyâ€™s metrics with its communication targets  
- **Group Three Lines Per Company:** Combines all summaries into a single formatted message per business  

From here:
- **All-companies Slack:** Sends a combined summary for all companies  
- **Per Company Slack:** Sends an individual message to each company channel using Slack Blocks  
- **Create Email â†’ Per Company Email:** Builds and delivers the weekly **Google Business Pulse** email to each companyâ€™s contact list  

This is the final step where insights become **actionable communications**, automatically shared with each business every week.
